Class StatsViewController

java.lang.Object
com.example.theaterproject.Controllers.StatsViewController
public class StatsViewController extends Object
Controller for the Stats view.

This controller populates a list of Movie objects and, based on the selected movie, displays the corresponding list of Screening objects. When a screening is selected, it computes and displays basic statistics: the number of tickets sold, the ticket price, and the revenue (tickets × price).

Data sources:

  • MovieService: provides the observable list of movies.
  • ShowroomService: provides screenings for a given movie.

Navigation:

  • onHomeButtonClick(ActionEvent) navigates to the editor (home) view.
  • onShowroomsButtonClick(ActionEvent) navigates to the showrooms view.

  • Field Details

    • aMoviesList

      private javafx.scene.control.ListView<Movie> aMoviesList
      ListView displaying available movies. Populated from MovieService.getMovies().

    • aScreeningList

      private javafx.scene.control.ListView<Screening> aScreeningList
      ListView displaying screenings for the selected movie. Populated via ShowroomService.getScreeningFor(Movie).

  • Method Details

    • initialize

      private void initialize()
      Initializes the Stats view.

      Responsibilities:

      • Populate aMoviesList from MovieService.
      • Listen to movie selection changes and update aScreeningList with screenings for that movie.
      • Listen to screening selection changes and update the statistic labels.
      • Set default label values using clearDetails().

      This method is automatically invoked by the JavaFX framework after FXML loading.

    • clearDetails

      private void clearDetails()
      Clears the statistics labels by setting them to default placeholder values. Used when no screening is selected or when filtering changes.

    • onHomeButtonClick

      private void onHomeButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent pEvent)
      Handles the "Home" button click event. Navigates back to the editor (home) view.
      Parameters:
      pEvent - the action event triggered by the button

    • onShowroomsButtonClick

      private void onShowroomsButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent pEvent)
      Handles the "Showrooms" button click event. Navigates to the showrooms view.
      Parameters:
      pEvent - the action event triggered by the button

    • onSignOutButtonClick

      private void onSignOutButtonClick(javafx.event.ActionEvent pEvent)
      Handles the sign out button click event. Opens the login view and closes the current window.
      Parameters:
      pEvent - the action event triggered by the sign out button
